text: 500 ml. no bottling date. Mostly clear, copper-brown pour with a thin creamy film. Aroma of cocoa, fig, plum, toffee and a touch of earthy smoke. Front flavors of earthy smoked meat, lightly tart berry and toffee. Finishes with some prune, cocoa powder, sour cream, earthy smoke and cured tobacco. Medium-plus body has smooth low-medium CO2 and an easy drinking balance with a mild sour. Well hidden 10%.

0.5 l bottle from Vormann Brauerei, 10% abv, bottled in 2014, cellared for more than two years. Clear, very dark reddish brown with a thin, dense, almost stable, beige head. Sweetish-malty, smoky, moderately roasty and a little sourish aroma of caramel, smoked ham, milk chocolate, some licorice and hints of dark fruits. Sweetish-malty, slighty sour, moderately roasty, quite smoky and a bit fruity taste of caramel, smoked ham, blackcurrant, raisins, ash, milk chocolate and some licorice, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter, quite roasty, smoky and tartish-dry finish. Over medium-bodied, minimally astringent and moderately effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Great balance between sweet, sour and smoked flavours, doesnt feel like 10% at all. Good!

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - Dark brown to black pour with beige head. Sweet and toasted malty, big caramel malty and light yeasty notes, some dark dried fruit, slight burnt sugar, sweet malty finish.

Tap @Bootleggers, Cph. Pours dark red brown with a small, staying creamy beige film head. Aroma has wet malts, rye bread, sourdough, caramel. Low carbonation, fine dry and quite oily mouthfeel. Flavour has burnt caramel, tart sourdough, vinious, a touch of strawberry, red apple. Very dry and quite bitter finish. Very different to much Ive tried and that says a lot.
Tasted from the tap on the 05/02/2017. Cloudy cola colour with a thin head. Aroma of light fruits, sweet caramel and some plums. Taste is almost the same with a cola finish. Next one please!

Nice, full of maltiness, dried, fruits, some caramel, straw, breadish, dark fruits, lightly smokey. Moderately to heavy sweet. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. ABV is well hidden. In overall very rich and good brew with nice dark fruits accents.

Klarowne, ciemnobrązowe z refleksami, piana przeciętna. W aromacie trochę jak barley wine, sporo karmelu, delikatne suszone owoce, są też wędzone, szynkowe nuty. W smaku za to kompletnie nie moja bajka - jest mocno kwaśne, a do tego dość intensywna wędzonka tworzy dla mnie połączenie nie do wypicia, a już na pewno nie w półlitrowej butelce. Nie wiem, czy to tylko moja partia, czy tak miało być, ale drugi raz nie spróbuję.

330ml generously sent by Beerhuner111 as a part of European Secret Santa swap, many thanks 
Weak fruity aroma, some malt and cellar scents. Taste is red fruit sour and coffee bitter. Coffee finish, light body, low C02, watery

Average frothy offwhite head. Good lacing. Fully diminishing. Clear average-density bronze-orange body. Aroma: moderate nutty malt, dark bread, leather, raisin, tart cherries, smoke, alcohol and chestnut. Initial flavor: moderate sweet and light acidic. Final flavor: light sweet moderate acidic light bitter; long duration. Palate: light medium body, watery/oily texture, medium carbonation and metallic light astringent finish. interessantíssima mescla entre dulçor maltado (lembrança de frutas secas e caramelo) com leve fundo defumado e acidez escalante (daí o sour do rótulo), seguidos ainda de levíssimo amargor no fundo. Esconde bem o alcool. Apesar do rótulo caracterizá-la como uma (Dortmunder) Altbier, a simples inclusão da palavra Sour juntamente ao estilo aliada ao fato da mesma ter 10% de ABV (o BJCP prevê entre 4,3 e 5,5%) já invalida uma análise que "penalize" essa cerveja por não conter determinados elementos. O pouco que combinou foi a forte presença maltada na backbone da cerveja e ésteres frutados (lembrando cereja) que podem sobreviver ao processo de lagerização. A cerveja esconde muito bem o teor alcoólico, mas há certo aquecimento no final do primeiro copo. Cerveja complexa, para ser degustada bem lentamente. A presença maltada fica ainda mais marcante nos últimos 20% da cerveja, quando a acidez é relegada a uma leve lembrança no céu da boca. 140 s

On draft at Churchkey. Pours a cloudy cola with a tan head. Tart berries in the nose. Cherry, tobacco and leather flavors. Interesting and a great antidote to the Bourbon County offerings that I came here for.
Brown-red, beige head, aroma of malt, bread, honey, caramel, toffee, flavor of toffee, caramel, sourish, medium bodied.

Draught at Bootleggers Craft Beer Bar. Dark, brown colour with a thin, lightly tanned head. Sweet aroma with caramel malts, dark dried fruits, spicy herbal notes. A tart, fruity note with citrus. Taste is light sweet with a tart edge. Full body with an oily texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes sweet and dry fruity with citrus and dark, over ripe fruits. Good, rather complex.

Coloração ambar escura de levíssima turbidez, espuma bege de ótima formação e persistência. Aroma de malte em primeiro plano, seguido de castanhas, leve caramelo, seca, álcool inicialmente discreto. Paladar de dulçor médio, defumado se inicia leve mas crescente, amargor torrado em segundo plano. Corpo e carbonatação médios. Final misto de defumado, malte, lúpulo vai ficando mais aparente junto com o o álcool, complexa. Muito boa!

500ml bottle on 7th Sep 2016: Shrewsbury beer share meeting, cheers Mat for this interesting brew. Ruby hue to the body, wispy head. The whole beer had an old feel and a good vibe: I found raisins, plums and dates in both the nose and taste: enough flavours to hide the 10% ABV. Really enjoyed my 5th of the bottle.

500ml bottle @ monthly tasting, Chez Sophie, Sep 16, courtesy of myself via Erzengel. Many thanks! Pours deep mahogany with a thin off-white head. Barley wine caramel on the nose. Taste is smooth, caramel, dark malts with a hidden underlying sourness. Quite a light body with some nutty old ale notes. Interesting.

WoW. A session able beer at only 10%. Great work. But dangerous.Deep nutty color with a off white head. Moderate intensity in the aroma. Medium (+) body and an average carbonation. Ok balance between sourness, acidity and sweetness. Mild smoked, toffee, dried fruits and some green apples.[Bottle from a trade with Erzengel</b]Norway - Germany 0-3
Fint humlet, og en dejlig frisk citrussmag i eftersmagen. Smager mest over i en pale ale.
A really nice sour alt. Dark amber, thin body, with a fantastic sour apple finish. Picked up a bottle at the Oedipus beer festival in 2016.
Almost porter-like slightly smoky with a slight tartness on the finish. Dark Amber with a creamy full head. Slight chocolate, dried fruit notes with a bit of wonderful mustiness. Simply lovely.

[8391-20160529] Tap. Toasted bready grains aroma. Dark dark red black body with a long-lasting foamy off-white head. Malty fruity sweet flavour has a bit of a soured fruit thing going on. Medium body. Interesting. (6/3/7/3/14) 3.3
(@ Hashigo Zake, Wellington, NZ)

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2016 2016-05-29. Nice brown body with a modest beige head and nice lace. Aroma of tangy malt, lightly toasty. Flavour is mild, lightly tangy malt, hint of dishwater and sourness but better than that sounds. Mild overall. Light malt. 6+ Average to light bodied palate, soft carbonation. 3+   6/4/6/3/12 On tap at Hasihigo Zake, Wellington, NZ.
Restrained aroma in a dirty brown black pour. An interesting combination of old ale flavours with a subtle sour background. Hides its strength well - probably too well to be honest.

Draught at CBF Wien.
Golden-amber, hazy body, with a small, creamy, off-white head.
Aroma of peaty smoke, spices, funk, sweet fruits, some caramel.
Taste follows this, with some more grains.
Medium, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes spicy, smokey, sweet, a bit fruity.

Good, but not exactly my cup of tea. Quite strange mix and not that balanced in my opinion. Still interesting stuff, but nothing I would try again.
Bottle. Cloudy amber body with white head. Aroma is fruity with malts. Taste is malty smoke fruits and nice sourness. Aftertaste is milk sour with smoke and hints of bitterness

On tap at the Thirsty Monk (5/20/15). Mild tart-sweet nose but not much else there. A tad smoky-meaty. Coppery amber clear with creamy off-white head. Medium-heavy body with medium carbonation. Starts sweet and smoky, meaty and a bit tangy. Nice tart-sweet-smoky finish with lingering nutty smoky after.
Aspecto marrom escuro translúcida, espuma beje e cremosa, odor maltado, sabor frutado, amadurecido, mel, alccolico. Poderia ser um pouco mais sour como diz o rotulo. Muito boa
UPDATED: APR 28, 2017 From WLVL. Almost a porter like roastiness. A hint of smoke. Rich but thinner than the taste. Serving: Bottle
Quase uma Stout. Lúpulo bem carregado. A leve acidez combina perfeitamente com o conjunto. Corpo bem forte, é uma cerveja para se beber bem devagar em ocasiões especiais.

Bottle. Full, sweet, light tart beer. The dominating flavour and aroma note are hazelnuts, complemented by cocoa and vinous notes mostly. The finish is very nutty and tannic, which enhances the subtle tartness of this beer and makes it rather astringent. Interesting, complex, unusual beer but too astringent for me.

Dark amber-color with creamy beige head. Aroma is smoked ham, tart berry fruits. Taste is smokey, dark malts, a fresh fruity tartness which just gives a hint of a Berliner Weisse feeling before the malt body takes over again and makes it clear that there is a lot of ABV in this brew. A bit of a Balsamico feeling as well. Well-balanced and superbly drinkable, but it has an idea of a booziness, at least it?s a bit warming. It already shows hints of johannisbeeren, which makes me want to drink the Johannisburger version again. Very fine-bubbled carbonation. Good brew!

Aromat: Paloność, delikatna kawa zbożowa, czekolada oraz śliwki.
Wygląd: Ciemny rubin, z obręczą piany.
Smak: Przyjemne kwaśne nuty (lecz bez przesady), z delikatną słodyczą karmelu i wędzonką. Dość mocna podbudowa słodowa wraz z owocami i niezłym ciałem. Do tego niskie wysycenie oraz goryczka.
Draught at in de Wildeman. Super soapy head. Black. Smoked aroma, like a campfire. Dry texture.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 kran w jabeerwocky. Jako ze jedno z wielu piw, to sie nie bede silil na jakies sensoryczne cudaniewidy, tylko ogolne wrazenie - kronikarsko - w cyferkach... niemniej: a) bylem swiecie przekonany, ze to ma byc piwo z niemal tylko slodowymi klimatami, a w praktyce sporo tu owocow, i to roznorakich... a nawet rodzynek b) oczywiscie slody tez sa, takie przyjemne, lekkie pieczywo, ciut karmelu c) calkiem przyzwoita goryczka d) bardzo pijalne, szybkosc z znikania z pokala niepokjaca wreczOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl.
@ The Beer Garden Store, Madrid, España.
A: Brown / Marron.
T/S: Roasted malt, caramel, smoked bacon, slightly hoppy / Malta tostada, caramelo, bacon ahumado, ligeramente a lupulo.

9.1.2016--Flasche-0,5L-bbf July_2014-"vintage". Dunkelbraun mit rötlichem Ton, hellbraune ordentliche Krone. Aroma:Rauchig, Melasse. Antrunk malzig, Portwein, Rauchmalz gegen Ende leicht säuerlich - ist durch die Lagerung interessanter geworden - nicht meine erste Flasche :-)
Has a smoked and dry aroma. Flavour is of dry fruit and has a persistent hop that goes to the aftertaste. Hints of caramel. Good body, good carbonation and well balanced.
Uma das melhores Altbier até o momento (12/2015). Amargor leve, pouco duradouro. Alcool aparece muito poico, bem equilibrada.

Vermelha escura, quase opaca. Espuma abundante de média duração. Aroma de caramelo e alcaçuz. Sabor de ameixas secas, cassis e tons defumados. Retrogosto adocicado com final alcoólico e licoroso. Complexa e muito saborosa.

Bottle. Pours a clear deep amber brown with a light brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a nice light smokiness with some sweet grains and a hint of light fruits. Flavor has a nice light smoke throughout with a sweet grain backbone and a hint of tartness.

Bottle thanks to Deyholla. Deep chestnut pour with a small head. Really interesting nose. Toasty, nutty and smoky. Rich. Ham and light balsamic. Peanut butter. Rich toasty malts. That may sound like a mess, but it works. Flavor is similarly complex. Slightly tart red fruits. Mellow smoke. Tasteful nitty malt. Perfect balance and drinkability. I cant believe this is 10%. Overall, a very engaging beer. Very impressive, boundary-pushing.
Brownish pour, very malty and heavy in a good way. Not a ton of alcohol for 10%, just big, malty & yeasty. Cool for something different.
Keg @ The Hanging Bat, Edinburgh. Pours dark brown, with a cream head. Nose of caramel, smoked meat and burnt sugar. Taste is chocolate, malty, more smoke, nice beer.
4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Hazy dark amber with beige head. Aromas of dark fruit, light alcohol. Tastes of dark fruit, caramel, malt. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
0,5 l pullo @ Werkmeisters place. Kirkas tummanruskea. Tuoksussa yritys savukinkkua, paahteista mallasta, savuisuutta. Maussa mukavaa kirpeyttä, viininmarjaa, humalaa, mallasta.

0,5l bottle at home shared by me from trade with Erzengel. BB 07/2014 (so a "bit" over the BB-date). dark brown color, small off-white head. smells smoked, spices, some roast, sausage, citric, lightly sour, light fruit notes. nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes lightly smoked, spices, fruit notes, plums, marzipan, raisins, acidic, finishes with plums and spice notes. very nice one. great balance, very light smoke notes, quite easy drinking.

Dark brown colour with coffee cream foam. Aroma: sour, smoky, milky, dried fruits. Tastes as above, smoky with medium sourness. Slick mouthfeel with little to medium carbonation. Interesting beer. Suprisingly enjoyable.

0,5l bottle shared by Werckmeister @ his place. Pours clear deep chestnut with a low off-white head. Aroma is slightly sour malts with some smoke. Flavor is slightly roasted malts, some sourness, nuts, smoke. Interesting!

(Bottle) Cloudy dark brown colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, fruity nose with notes of dried fruit, raisins, prunes, dark bread, brown sugar and a light vinegar acidity. Slightly vinous. Malty, fruity, slightly tart taste with caramel, dried fruit, raisins, prunes, black-currant, dark bread, roasted malt, hints of balsamic vinegar and a tart finish with a light bitterness. Almost full body, smooth mouthfeel, with a certain sweetness. Alcohol well hidden under the tartness. Quite different and very interesting. Nice one.
Keg at the bow bar. Pours deep ruby brown, nose is smoked sausage, malty, light funk, taste is meaty, smoky, roasted.
Keg at the bow bar. Pours hazy brown with a thin beige head. Aromas are smoky liquorice, light sour. Taste is meaty, smoke. Smoky sour finish. Smoky

On tap at Fine Mousse, Paris.
A brilliant brew from a brilliant brewery! Medium sourness with load of fruity notes and a strong woody backbone. Carbonation is on the high side, with a dry finish which calls for another sip. This beer reminds me a lot about a Flanders Red. Simply excellent!

Keg at Bow Bar. Nose is malts, spices, even some meat. Taste is quite odd, or different, some strong barley wine style sweet maltiness, but slightly sour, boozy, spicy, some coffee and stout elements. Bitter malty finish. Interesting but wouldnt maybe buy again.
Keg at bow... Dark brown.. Thin tan lacing... Soft sweet toffee chocolate roast malts nose... Dark malts.. Light smoke malt.. Soft light smoke chocolate i

Tap at piwoteka narodowa. Dark cooper color, big tan head. Aroma is fruits, dried grapes, caramel, hint od roasty malt. Taste is sweet, Light dry, hint of sour. Flavor od dried fruits, caramel. Full body, moderate carbonation.
Dark amber colour; quite nice head with lacing. Quite tart aroma with lot of dried fruits, melanoidins and honey. Sweet taste with also fruits, honey and some floral notes.

Draught. Poured dark brown, ruby reflexes, small beige head. Aroma is quite clear with some toasted malts and low level of funkiness. In taste nothing much is happening, some xaramel and toasted notes, alcohol completely hidden. Full bodied, low bitter finish. In overall good strong beer, but there is almost nothing going on here.
Aromat mocno funky, przyprawowy, owocowy. W smaku dość kwaśne. Alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty. Bardzo złożone.
Tap @ Beer Geek Madness 3. Aroma of malts, with roasted notes. Taste is very complex with woody notes, hints of sourness, full bodied. Well hidden alcohol. Very interesting.

Bardzo dobry aromat. Lekkie nuty drewniane.
W smaku palone, mocne , drewniane.
Czuć alkohol, ale nie przeszkadza.

Aroma: funky notes, smoky, malty, caramel, fruity
Taste: medium sweet, light sour, malty, fruity

Aroma: sour, smoked, bonfire, roasted dark malts, funky, crunchy bread skin.
Appearance: deep brown color and nicecreamy head.
Taste: sour combined with smoked notes, roasted, bread skin, very smooth, well-covered alcohol, semi-dry/semi-sweet.
Palate: full body and low carbonation, sour smoked finish.
Overall: Thats great beer, so complex, smooth, tasty and easy drinking. Highly recommended to try.
Wypite podczas BGM3. W aromacie czerwone / suszone owoce, s?odowo??. W smaku czerwone / suszone owoce, lekki alkohol, lekka kwa?no??. Fajne piwo

Bottle received in the European Secret Summer Santa, thanks McTapps. Hazy dark chestnut brown with a medium sized beige head. Nose has dark bread, dark dried fruits, black berries, meaty smoke. Flavour is nice and mellow with dark bread, wood, chalk, light meaty smoke, earth and then a fine touch of dark sour berries. Medium body, soft carbonation, filling sweetness, low bitterness, light sour. Feels good in the mouth and carries the abv incredibly well. Some light heat in the finish, but integrates well with the soft malt and light sourness. As I see it this is inventive and well carried out.

Flasche (50 cl) von Hopfen & Malz, Berlin; mindestens 1 Jahr im heimischen Keller gelagert. - Tiefstes Kastanienbraun, trüb; fast schaumlos. - Der markante aber doch vornehme Duft erinnert mit kräftiger, holzig-erdiger Hopfenherbe und etwas Tabak über schwerem Dunkelmalz und nur mildem Karamel an ein gutes englisches Ale; eine ganz zart säuerliche Note wirkt in keiner Weise störend. - Im Antrunk kräftige holzig-krautige Hopfenherbe, dezentes Karamel, Bitterschokolade und eine mild säuerliche Note, die aber von der wuchtigen Hopfenbittere verdrängt wird und im weiteren Verlauf kaum noch zum Tragen kommt. Mild rezent, für ein Bier dieser Stärke fast schlank; glatt. Die 10 % Alkohol sind kaum zu schmecken. Im Abgang trocken und schwach adstringierend mit schwerer erdiger Hopfenbittere und kühlen holzigen Tabaknoten. - Entgegen meinen Befürchtungen (ein Sauerbier von 10 %?) sehr gut trinkbar und gediegen. Die wuchtige aber nicht aufdringliche Hopfung bestimmt den Charakter dieses Bieres weit mehr als der hohe Alkoholgehalt. Große Klasse, dieses Adambier!

500 ml bottle poured a clear reddish brown with a lasting creamy tan head. Aromas of toffee, tobacco, earthiness and a hint of fruitiness. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of toffee, tobacco, light earthiness and light fruitiness with a smooth dry lingering tobacco finish.

Keg beer geek Prague. Red n black ok head. Aroma is dark fruits smokey bacon dark malts taste same great sweetness light smokey bitter finish. Nice oily mouthfeel. No sign of abv ridiculously drinkable!!!

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2015 Undated bottle. Lightly hazed brown with a short off-white head. Malty aroma is nuts, toast, burnt bread crust, sweet dates, leather, acetic acid (balsamic in character). Medium bodied, sweet and succulent approach, light bodied in a faintly acidic finish. Creamy and smooth texture, with a small warming from alcohol. The malt creates some interest, and the acidic / sourness is minimal, and it seems to represent well the aroma and flavor impression you can imagine from these rich old world beers that show the faintest bit of acidity, that little resemblance to Oud Bruin.

At a tasting, thanks, stable bubbly off white head, hazy lightish brown color, aroma of dark bread and dark fruit, same traits in flavor with some chocolate and fruit cake in the back, astringent bitterness, medium quite mellow sourness. Nice but a little to heavy.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2015 Re-rate 10/15: Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks Tom C. Smoke, caramel, fruitiness. Sweet, sourish hint. 7/3/7/3/15=3.5

Bottle shared at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Erzengel for this bottle! Murky brown. Aroma of malt, caramel, a bit of chocolate, oxidation, dark fruits, toast. Sweet-sourish flavor with malt, caramel, dark fruits, a bit of toast, and a bitterish finish. Medium-bodied, quite rounded. Nice and interesting. 6/3/7/4/14=3.4

Verre de dégustation, provenant dune bouteille de 500 ml, au Mondial de la Bière 2015 (Montréal, QC) au coût de 5,00$. Arôme: Légère odeur de céréales grillées et de caramel. Apparence: La couleur est dorée-cuivrée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de fruité légèrement sûrette avec une pointe de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est mince avec une texture légèrement aqueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement sûrette. (Rating #6400)

sample at mondial de la bière 2015, mtl. unclear dark but bright golde orange with a reviving beige head, good retention and lacing. toasted wheaty caramel - multilayers: spicy, fruity, nutty and woodsy smoked caramel, raisins and dried fruits-plenty, lightly smoked berries, hint of sweetness - brown sugar. light carbonation, medium body - oily; warming but never boozy, gently tart spicy-woosy finish. raisin pie cooked under a wisp of smoke. complex malt depth. style broadening enlightenment. good.
Bottle 50cl @ Kultainen Apina. Pours reddish brown small head. Earthy, berries aroma. Tart, berry flavour.

A hazed copper amber alt with a thin white head. In aroma, sweet caramel malt with light grassy hops, light mineral notes, OK. In mouth, a tart malt with light grassy hops, light mineral notes, light cherry notes, OK. Bottle at Mondial 2015.

Tap pour during Sour Fest at Brouwers Cafe with commonshawn and rosskyle. Aroma is definitely sour fruit with a candied sugar presence. Plums and raisins. Dark brown with a little amber. Tan head with minimal lacing. Taste keeps the dark fruit elements going with even a slight hint of caramel. Drinks like a Belgian pushing towards a quad but the end rounds out sour. Better than expected probably because I wasnt all that excited about a sour and this isnt aggressively in that vein.

Draft pour at Brouwers Cafe as part of the sour fest. Pours a dark reddish brown with a big bubble head to it. For the record, I never knew a sour altbier even existed, so this was a nice suprise. A bit of a bran like aroma and flavor with some sour fruit blended in there. Bonus points for uniqueness. Fun beer to try. Tasty stuff.

500 ml bottle to snifter. Looks solid; a cloudy dark amberish brown with very light brown head that steadily dissipates into thin lacing. Smells malty and mildly tart. Tastes like it smells with some mild smoke as well. Mouthfeel is medium full-bodied and smooth; drinks closer to 7% than 10%. Its definitely on the mild side of sours, but is unique and enjoyable.

The label said "strong sour Altbier" - there was no way I wasnt buying this - pours a dark ruby - not really sour, more like mildly tart, but anyway - the nose dark bread, light smokiness, some dark fruit, and very light lactic tartness - surprisingly subtle flavor, with well-disguises alcohol - I would not guess even close to 10% it blind - taste is light smoke, raisin, mild caramelized sugars - the mild lactic tartness combines with the malt to create a sort of tart cherry character - finish of mild smoke, mild spice - only in the finish do you sense any alcohol - light lingering tannic character - interesting brew.
Bottle @benzai. Brown color with a small white head. Smells smokey, malty, caramel. And tastes the same
Bottle @ Roels first weekly tasting. Amber to ruby colour with a small off-white head. Smells red fruit, cork, smokey. Tastes sourish, smoked malts, slightly red fruits. Medium body, soft carbo.

Schönes nicht alltägliches Bier 
Die Fruchtnote (holunder) kommt sehr gut raus was sehr gut zu der leichten rauch note passt allerdings is es mir für ein "Sour" zu mild, und das bier hat mich nicht besonders vom hocker gehaun was ich eigentlich erwartet hätte

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Hazy brown colour with a small tan head.
Aroma: Caramel, malt, vinous, caramel, dried fruit.
Body: Full body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Dried fruit, spices, berries, caramel, a bit sour.

Dark amber colored body, medium sized off-white head with soapy lacing. Leather, smoldering tobacco, berries, cherries, caramel, biscuit, and earth. Medium bodied with smooth carbonation, light sweetness, and mild acidity.

Flaska 50 cl. Mörkt orange öl med ett smutsvitt skum. Dofter av karamell, gräs, trä. Något vinös i både smak och doft. Smakinslag av karamell, trä, citrus, malt och rök. Medelstor kropp. Rund munkänsla. Det blir väl mycket öl på 10 % när allt äntligen är uppdrucket.

Very cloudy burned orange maybe some butterscotch looking, light head but a slight gusher. it could be that we used a lighter to open this beer since we are all German. Smells nice with a good sweetness and a touch of lemon candies. slight medicinal nose. Tart with smokey rye malt and maybe some band-aid but the tartness is nice. lemon and sweet. I get a little ginger. OJ finish
Geruch leicht rauchig, nach frischen Beeren, schwach malzig. Geschmack ebenfalls rauchig-fruchtig, Säure relativ schwach ausgeprägt.
Geruch ein bisschen rauchig. Im Geschmack dann wirklich rauchig. Nicht ganz mein Fall.

# 3515
ersma: wird bei vormann gebraut. die machen ja so allerhand, z. b. für freigeist oder ale mania (ehem. fritzale).
tief dunkelbraun, fast schwarz. oben verhaltene verschäumung, die schnell weg ist.
der geruch ist röstmalzig mit schokonoten und etwas vanille.
der antrunk gibt sich röstmalzig und süßlich, auch hier schoko, dazu melasse und pflaume. dahinten eine leichte säuerlichkeit, die zur mitte etwas deutlicher in erscheinung tritt. ansonsten bleibt es süßlich, melassig mit röstaromen und schoko. hopfen kommt auch hinzu, der abgang wird sogar überraschend herb, wobei das nicht übertrieben herb ist, nur mehr als man bei diesem bier erwartet hätte. abnehmende süße, die säuerlichkeit bleibt vorhanden, ist aber wenig ausgeprägt.
die flasche ist mit dem kleinstgedruckten etwas unübersichtlich.
fazit: das melassige stört anfangs doch sehr. die säuerlichkeit ist weniger ausgeprägt als der name vermuten lässt. insgesamt aber gut trinkbar.
8,8,10,10,8,9 - 9,00
Yellow brown pour, big fluffy head. Aroma char leather. Tastes mesquite, woody, tang of apple cider. Thick palate slight drying.

500ml bottle. Wonderful clear, ruby red glowing, dark brown colour with small to average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white to beige head. Dry, tannic aroma with notes of leather, red fruit parings, a touch of red berries, blueberry, elderberry. Taste is more dry than tart, slightly tannic, hints of leather and fruit parings, grapes, red and blue berries, elderberry, a herbal touch; perfectly hidden alcohol. Almost light, dangerously drinkable. Still more Altbier than Sour Ale for me.

W aromacie spora dzikość i kwaskowość, białe owoce, kwaśne jabłko i agrest, nieco karmelu. W smaku słodko - kwaśne, jabłkowa słodycz plus wyraźny, lekko ściągający kwasek. Pijalne, choć nie dla początkujących piwoszy.

Dark copper. Thin tan head. Slightly malty aroma. A little too sweet. Not really that good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Lactic molasses and malt aroma. Dark brown with small head. Smoky-sour barnyard and lightly sweet molasses malt flavor. Great mixture of flavors without any dominating. Delicious.

Bottle:
Dark cola-brown with a thin, off-white head.
Smoky, wody aroma., dark berry.
Taste is heavy berry, smoke, chocolate malt.
Slightly tart and vinous.
Really nice, almost chewy in body.

Tantalizing, complex aroma. Teakwood brown color. The aroma has a hint of mild funkiness, with caramel and a touch of dark fruit. Flavor very complex, with mild sourness mixing with malt sweetness, some hop bitterness. It all comes together quite nicely! Substantial body to this beer.

Sampled at Festival der Bierkulturen, Koln. Pours clear dark brown with an off white head. Aroma is light funky with red fruits, caramel and malt. Flavor is moderate sweet and light moderate acidic. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle. Pours brown with white head. Nose and taste of grape bubblegum, sour dark berry, toffee, caramel and blackberry. Medium body.
Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends 13/6-14. Aroma: Yeast, some smokey notes. Taste: Fruity, berries, sweet, a bit funky.

New Beer Distributors, NYC 50cl ($5): Pours amber brown with an off-white head. Aroma is berries, vinous a bit, yeast, and malts. Taste is sugary and sour, but then hits off at the end with a nice little hoppy bite. Alcohol is very well covered.

500 ml bottle from Les Vignerons. Deep and dark amber, slighty hazy, with a nice, creamy, forever lasting light beige head. Sharp, very fruity and slightly tannic nose. Definitely some light/white wine qualities to it. Light malt presence, grapes, maybe a hint of dark fruits or wild type of berries. Surprisingly zero alcool smell. Pleasent and intriguing nose overall. Quite different in the mouth. Again a winey presence, redd-ish this time tho, quite slick and oily, slightly warming, but in no way Id have guessed about 10%. Some wet wood/earth presence, solid malt backbone, less fruity and more dark/roasted compared to the aroma. Very mild sourness, its more tart. Average carbonation, medium body, oily texture. What a surprise! Extremely good.

BOTTLE 50CL from Erzengel. Thnankls

Look: clear dark ruby-brown, small beige frothy head with poor retention.
Aroma: vinous - stale wine/light vinegar, nice malty character with dark fruit tones (prunes, figs, cranberries), some yeast/dough, some chocolate even!
Taste: again, malt sweetness, dark fruit with light vinous acidity. Medium to rich body, still drinkable. The 10% abv are nowhere to be found.
At FdB 2014. Poured hazy reddish amber with a small off white head. Aroma of sour, vinous fruit, light mocha. Medium to full body, flavour as the aroma, pretty sour.

Bottle. Dark pour, thin head. Aroma is very toasty, roasty, dark chocolate, light soured wheaty notes. Taste is roasty, light sourness, tart with a lot of burnt grain, light coffee, chocolaty notes. Palate is med full bodied with medium carbonation. Not bad, but quite difficult to drink, rather heavy which clashes with the dry sour style.

Bottle 500ml. [ As The Monarchy Methusalem ].Clear medium to dark red amber color with a average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, bread, wood, dried fruit, moderate caramel, tart notes. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, dried fruit, wood, bread, sharp, tart, sour malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20140328]
Nose is medium raspberry, red apple, weak leaves, almond, feel is medium, taste is red berries, wood chip, red apple zest note, mellow, sour finish with note of red currant

A- Deep brownish red color with little to no head.

S- Raisin, coffee, light sourness, smoke, grape

T- Lightly toasted malt up front followed by sour throughout the middle, smoke, burnt malt, raisin on the finish.

M- Medium bodied with a decent level of carbonation.

D- The sourness may be a little over the top but this may be one of the most interesting brews ive ever had.

Murky brown color, and decent foamy head. Aromas of sweet malts, toffee, molasse and hints of salty smoke. 

Has a soft malty beginning, while a pleasant warmth flows through the body. Smoke flavor goes very well with the Altbier-character, adds a grainy complexity with subtle hints of salt to it. After the salt gets detectable on the palate along with wood and musty yeast, a huge sourness emerges and threatens to overwhelm the palate. As the beer warms up, the lactic acid driven sourness decreases, and leaves some space for zingy salts and wooden malts on the palate. Full bodied beer, which contains completely different layers, which all melt together in a very unique flavor. At first this seems to fail, due to the enormous sourness, which misses essential balance, but as the beer gets warmer it becomes very enjoyable. Leads to a long lasting vinous, roasted, sour finish.
Dark brown color with medium beige head. Sour aroma together with caramel, fruity notes, coffee. Same in taste. Not that sour though.

Dosc dobre piwo ze spora pianka, miedzianym ciemnawym kolorem, karmelowym smakiem lekkim kwaskowym posmakiem, niewielka goryczka. Alkohol nie wyczuwalny, piwo dla mnie rasowego milosnika kwaskowych gueuze bylo zbyt delikatne w tej materii Sour Ale. Bo nie przypominalo tego stylu wogole. Ale slodowosc za to bardzo bogata i to nieco ratuje ogolna ocene tego piwa

Poured from tap to glass. Brown hue with tan head that lingered. Aroma is cereal, caramel, smoke, cherry, plums, molasses, vanilla. Mouthfeel is great with a light body and good carbonation. Taste is dry with a tart smoky finish. Overall this is crazy but it works!

Davvero unottima birra, anche se non la si invecchia per 900 anni. Gusto ricco, con note di caramello, melassa, uvetta e una punta acidula perfettamente bilanciata con lo sfondo dolce. Prodotto eccellente.

On tap @ La Fine Mousse (Paris). Dark amber-brown with medium fully lasting off-white head and heavy lacing. Aroma is of caramel, raisins, molasses, fruits and hints of smoke. Taste is slightly sweet with raisins, caramel, molasses, light fruits, hints of smoke, light acidic presence and some alcohol warming. Medium body (watery at times). Moderate carbonation. Interesting beer. Body is a bit weak for such a high abv beer. Not extremely complex, but tasty.

courtesy of Maria Rothacher - pours a clear dark brown beer with a modest foam left; fairly malty with notes of smoked meat and earth; full-bodied, some fair sweetness nicely balanced by a subtle sourness; very long earthy malty finish with more light smokey notes

Bottle, 10%. Dark amber/brown with small beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, oak, notes of smoke and a little dark fruit. Flavour is malt, caramel, smoke, sour, oak, fruit, little dark fruits and medium sweet.

Bottle @ Johns. Pours dark brown with a fading offwhite head. Aroma is light malt, light sour, little salt, hints of caramel. Flavor malt, light sweet, caramel, little sour, salt, light smoke. Medium body, soft carbonation, hiddes alcohol very well for the ABV. 280314

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy amber red with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and dark fruit. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet finish with a little warming alcohol. 280314
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits, bread, cheese, citrus and hops. Light sour.
Med ölföreningen julen 2013. Smak och doft av karamell, fikon, russin, plommon med chokladtoner. Syrlig, fruktig, tydlig beska med smak av te.

Hazy chestnut brown, no head. Fig, date fruitiness on the nose with a touch of brown sugar. Sweet, touch of tartness, more brown sugar, fairly straightforward. Worthy experiment but does not really hit any high notes.
Draught.Dark reddish colour with small head.Aroma of ripped dry berries and earth,spices and caramel,odd type of beer,sweet and sticky with medium sweet taste and light malty finish.

(draught) pours a hazy deep ruby colour with a frothy light-beige head. aroma of smoked ham, caramel, alcohol, roasted malts, herbal hops and earth. flavour is heavily peaty, with more roasted malts, some smoked ham, earth, alcohol and corn cobs. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.

0,5 l bottle BB July 2014 
caramel, bread, cereal, citrus, floral, earthy, basement aromas, alcohol, brown, clear, frothy, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, full body, oily feel, creamy, sticky, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish 
good stuff

Klar mörk röd öl med lite brunt, brun-orange skum. Doft: Malt, lite humle, porter/madeira, kompost, jord. Smak: Röda bär, vin, humle, blandad frukt konserv. Jordig eftersmaken som drar lite åt rödvin.

50 cl bottle @ Timo A.
Pours dark clear mahogany color with a small head. Aroma is quite sweet and sugary, some ripe fruits with caramel and some. Flavor is quite complex, ripe fruits, with sweet caramel malts and some toffee, sourish fruits, some wooden notes with hints of port and cognac, dark berries, faint anise and some alcohol on the finish. No Alt elements here really, more like a mildly sour Barley wine. Very unique and interesting, definitely in a good way.
5346

500 ml bottlw, thanks Timo A. Pours a dark ruby brown colour with a small head. Very complex and original and aroma of cognac, palm cake, dark berries and mint. Rich flavour of berries, dark chocolate, fresh mint, anise, mild sourness, herbal hops, mild sweetness and grass. Medium bodied, dry mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Refreshing minty finish with some sweetness. Alcohol is well hidden. A very unique beer. Lovely.

Bottle. Deep copper liquid with small off-white head. Aroma of citrus, toffee, tobacco, smoke, bread, toast and biscuit. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of toffee, smoke, raw sugar and bread. Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. Meh.
Sour and smokey aroma. Caramel, chocolate, smoke and funk. Not my type of beer. Very strange.

500ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkel rötlich-braunes Bier mit sehr wenig Schaum. Geruch fruchtig, säuerlich, röstmalzig. Geschmack angenehm röstmalzig, dann kommt eine leichte fruchtige Säure ins Spiel und zum Schluss angenehme schokoladige Aromen. Den hohen Alkoholgehalt merkt man bei diesem Bier nicht besonders viel. Insgesamt ein sehr gut gelungenes Bier.

Bottled rom Systembolaget
Brown with a medium, bubbly head. 
Roasted and vinous aroma with sourish notes. Some leather too. 
Tidbits in the flavour along with dark toffee and some leather. 
Medium, dry, lingering bitterness.
The head is ok, body dark-red. It smells mild, dry, wooden. The taste is mild, bit fruity, alcoholic, cherry, alcoholic-bitter, plum, interesting.
Bottled:Pours clear, deep red with a small head. Aroma is sourish berries, wood and toffee. Sourish flavour with notes of red berries, toffee and wood. Alcohol is well hidden.

500ml bottle.
Pours a dark mahogany copper, with an off-white head.
Complex, spicy, sour aroma, caramel, dark fruits, candied sugar, wood (?), licorice root, leather, dried fruits.
Off-dry, medium body, low to mid bitterness, slightly low CO2.
Complex, sour, faintly funky taste, caramel, chocolate, hops, coffee, wood, earth, a slightly salty tinge, tea leaves (Keemun?).
This is a very intriguing beer, very complex, and quite unlike anything else. Reminds me of some of the Flemish oude beers, but at the same time totally different. Really good! (2013-12-30)

Bottle (50 cl) from Systembolaget. Clear chestnut, low head. Grainy, sugary, caramelly and nutty malt aroma, alcohol very well hidden. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness, no acidity.

500ml bottle, pours opaque dark mahogany with a small tan head that quickly reduced. Aroma and taste of plums, raisins, muscovado and caramel. Light sweetness, medium bitterness and light sourness. Medium body, oily texture and lively carbonation. An okay beer overall, but I dont like the combination of sourness with these flavours.

Bottle from SB cons 2013-12-11 Göteborg
AR: vinos, malty, melas
AP: dark reddish brown, wee beige head
F: sweet and sour, warming feeling, salty, red berry fruitinees, rich heavy carbonation, great bitternees, sugary feeling

Pours dark cherries with no head. Aroma is cherries, honey, brown sugar, slight funk. Taste is cherries, brown sugar, rye bread. Quite bland unfortunately.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours brown amber with no head
Aromas of sour cherries, bisquits, toffee
Taste is sour with hints of altbier style
Bit one dimensional

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours Coca-Cola brown with low tan head. Aroma of toffee, crackers, light spices, nice! Taste is light tart, fairly bland with some funky off-flavours. Body is light with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Hazy nut brown, small head. Caramelly and earthy with mild milky tartness. Full bodied with soft muthfeel. Mildy warming with black currants and earthy roasty malt. Fairly low bitterness. Interesting and well made.

Flaska från SB. Spännnde sötsyrlig maltig öl med en rejäl beska. Torkad frukt, lätt kryddig. Beskan drar åt plommonkärnor och helhetsupplevelsen som att dricka starkt och besk engelskt te. Riktigt trevlig.

Bottle. Aroma is brimful of dried fruit, hint of hops. Thick toffee and caramel taste, dried fruits galore, midway through the sourness starts to show. Finish is a lovely combo of dried fruit, lactic acid and malts. Pleasant.
Bottle - Dark brown in colour. Raisins, nuts and some woodny notes in the aroma. Spicy, fruity and tart taste with marzipan, fruitcake and plums standing out.

Bottle. 

Clear copper with a white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, fruit and some light hops. The taste was interesting, a bit sour with light roasted malt, sweet dark fruit and some light spices. Well hidden alcohol. I think that this was my first ever Adambier, I would not hesitate to try anorher one.

Bottle at Hamnmästaren, MalmöDark brown color with small creamy head. Mild caramel aroma, lightly dusty. It has a good body, nowhere near what was expected (its lean); caramel flavor with a subtle sour vein and a nutty touch; the bitterness is medium-low.Very interesting.

Draft pour on tap at Local Option (Chicago, IL). Pours a decent brownish hue overall, some gentle light on the edges, darker middle doesnt let much light through, a bit murky with a small tannish head atop that dissipates quickly, skant ring that laces minimally. Aromas show a more significant malt presence, sticky toffee and carmelized malts, gentle toastiness meet fig, dried fruit, touches of raisin. Some gentle red fruit, mellow sourness on the nose is quite subtle, as this thing presents that firm darker malt feel. Initial is a touch bitter up front quickly moving to toast, caramel, biscuits and sweeter dark sturdy malts. Some dark fruit influence starts to grow, some raisins, gentle brown sugar and toffee. Gentle lactic element starts to hit into the middle, subtle but there, some gentle cherry meets more gentle toasty and roasty malts, biscuity and semi sweet at times. Backend is some currant, mellow sourness and biscuits trailing out. An odd combo, the sweetness and brown/biscuity caramel and lactic element doesnt necessarily play well for me. A bit warm, the size is significant and definitely can take you at times. Finish is some toastiness and lactic elements hanging on. Man, a bit clunky, Im not really sure where such a beer fits in. But its not quite my thing as a sour fan.
To me this was like a super sweet "Altwine". It didnt have any sourness and was simply malt.
Bottle, courtesy of MisoW, many thanks. Dark brown color. Sour aroma with caramel, coffee. Taste, Taste is sourish, coffee, chocolate, sugary, dark berries. Very good beer.

On tap at Paradiso Dupont. Pours a translucent root beer brown with one ring of white head. Nose of bread crust, malt, some prune, some raisin, malt, a little brown sugar, some lingering tartness. Flavor has dried fruit, some baked apple, a little more candy, wood pulp, herbal, some bad red wine. Acetic finish. A little odd.

Bottled. Dark brown color with white off head. Nice taste development with sweet sart followed by some sourness finished in bitterness which lingers in aftertaste. Well ballanced rich taste of malt, ripe fruit, chocolate. Full bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle, courtesy of MisoW, many thanks.  Dark brown color with medium beige head. Sour aroma together with caramel, fruity notes, coffee. Taste, roasted malt, coffee, vinous tartness. Tart finish. Tasty,

Bottle by MisoW, many thanks! The malty sour aroma and taste of this delicious Altbier is fantastic! I love sour food like sourkruta or gerkins hence this is my kind a great sipper. The 10% abv is very well hidden. Overall this beer is a delicacy and should be drunk too fast.

Bottle. Aroma is mostly caramel sweet with light fruits. Taste is very finely balanced. Sourness is really light, moderate fruitiness. Neglectable hoppiness. This beer is enjoyablevin its own way. Not world class though.

Bottle from trade with Erzengel and ThirstyBird, many thanks for new style. Pours brown color, beige head. Aroma is coffee, sourish, brown sugar, milk chocolate. Taste is sourish, coffee, chocolate, sugary, dark berries. Very nice beer.

Style #61.

Bottle (and tapped @Festival der Bierkulturen):Deep ruby-amber coloured, clear with a small and persistent loose white head, solid aromas of dried fruits, caramel, dark malt and old wine with a shy cellary touch; almost solid bitter-sweet flavour, pretty full bodied; lingering and warming vinous and tart-sourish finish with a sweetish caramelly counterpart. Fine, fine stuff

Bottle, Danke Günther! Bright red, low head. Wooden, light chocolate, almond blackberries inthe aroma. Dry tar tart on the tongue, light sparkly, moderate sourness though. Roasted, berrylike and fruity, nutty, chocolate and coffee notes, a hint oak. Good balance between the rich and the tart side makes this deceptively drinkable. Gets a little byt dry and starchy towards the end.

bottle from pivnizub - thanks! Deep brown colour, almost black, no head to mention. Sour-fruity start, not unpleasant, not vinegar-like, with a malty flavour detectable, like a good hand-crafted Alt witha sour touch. Nice.

Almost black, small head. Not as rich as expected, dark roast, fig, malty, not very expressive. Looks good but not as special as expected. Nice body though, full time enough. (Bottle from La Cave à Bulles)

Pours a brown/orange color with a small loose tan head. The smell is caramel malt, sour fruit. The taste is dark fruit, caramel malt - crisp an dry...I dont get much sourness. Medium body with nice carbonation - fine construction.

Bottle from Braustelle. Malty nose, caramel, raisins, like a sticke. Pretty dark reddish-brown color with lace. Sweet and malty flavor, chocolate, cherry, raisin, alcohol. Sticke-like, and not sour at all. Some lactic stuff going on, but just a bit. Nice fruity malt. Good. Maybe it needs more time to develop sourness.

Clear dark brown colour, off-white head. Aroma of caramel, toast, malts, hops and light cherry. Bitter flavour, caramel, burned sugar, malts, light sweet dried fruit notes. Bitter finish, roasted sugar, light coffee, lingering sweet notes. Nice!
(From 0.5L bottle @ The Morning After RBBSG II tasting, Gent 2013. Thanks for sharing, Rian!)
Bottle at Yesprs - Thanks. Clear brown - offwhite head. Bitterness, light sourness, amber malts, ryebread, acid, burned/roasted notes, fruity.

Bottle @ yespr. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy caramel aroma. Fruity malty spicy caramel flavor with weak sour hints. Has a fruity malty spicy weak sour caramel finish.
Bottle, thank you to Erzengel. Pours dark reddish brown with almost no foam. Smells very sour with hints of cherries and currents.

Pours a clear reddish brown with foamy off-white head. Aroma of dark fruit, plums, raisins, dark chocolate. The rich full body tastes sweet and malty balanced by a light sourness. Very roasty aftertaste, alcohol is completely hidden. Very tasty!

Bottle 0.5l from Edeka Mohr Bonn. Pours rather deep brown. Aroma is roasted, malty, like Stout. Taste is malty, just hints of sourness, rather sweet. Alcohol is present. Very strong and the lack of bitterness makes this beer somehow unbalanced. From the description I thought this would be a blend of oude bruin and alt beer. But I missed the hoppy bitterness of alt and the sourness of Oude Bruin. Strange brew.

10/VIII/13 - 50cl bottle @ RBBSG II, my place - BB: n/a (2013-722) Thanks to ThirstyBird for sharing the bottle!
Clear red brown beer, irregular off-white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: toast, malty, some hay. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: little hoppy, some citrus, caramel, bit of dried fruits, cocoa powder. Aftertaste: little bitter, coco powder, caramel, bit sugary, hops.

Many thanks to Pivnizub for this one! Pours out in a light cloudy red-amber colour with low head and medium body. Nose of malt and nuts. Taste of acid, sourness, light vinegar, leaves, citrus, hops and barley. Light smokey hints. Expected and hoped it will be little more sour and less bitter. Nice to drink, refreshing all the way, but just little bit too malty, bitter and roasty.
Danke an pivnizub! Eine erstaunliche Erfahrung fürwahr. Ein leicht säuerliches mit etwas pflaume und einer erstaunlich derben bitterkeit zum Schluss. Nicht schlecht, aber etwas zu streng und muffig.

50cl bottle into tulip glass. Pours deep dark brown with medium sudsy head. Nose is licorice, root beer, raisins, pears. Mouthfeel is thick, sticky, malty. Taste is earthy, roasty, raisins, licorice, faint bitterness, maple notes, molasses, chocolate notes, gingerbread, smokey notes. Finish is slightly boozy, but not unpleasant. Label says "strong sour altbier" but this is not really sour at all. A fine beer, but takes a bit of work to get through, a sipper.

Bottl, thanks to ThirstyBird! 500 ml, filled to the top, ABV 10%. Poured into an altbier type glass but I am switching into a snifter after this. 
Clear body, very dark brown colour on the body, probably the darkest altbier Ive had till now. One finger of off-white to beige head, with good retention for its size and light lacing left on the glass.
Lighty roasted malts on the aroma and quite a usual altbier aroma but! with some sour white grapes this time, lightly acidic.
Very light sourness on the taste and even then, more on the aftertaste. Mostly roasted malts, chocolate, a little bit of coffee. Very balanced between sourness and bitterness, this tastes like a good, old Russian Imperial Stout. The alcohol very well hidden and if I keep drinking it out of this glass Ill be gone in no time. 
Medium thick body, low carbonation but it doesnt need more.
Really great beer, once again thanks to ThirstyBird.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2013 50cl bulky bottle with xeroxed label, courtesy of ThirstyBird. The 10% ABV on the label is hard to read and to believe...Like an infinitely aged Gouden Band poured into an old Alt, this majestic Alt has all the dry, aged-on-oak qualities of a Flemish Sour Ale without the actual vinegar acidity. Oak astringent palate, swallowing all residual caramalt Alt sugars, reenforced by a rather austere earschmalz hop bitterness. Very impressed if this should actually pack 10%, and probably still more honestly categorised as an Alt than as a sour...

Sampled from bottle @ RBBSG II. Slightly unclear amber to dark red color, small off - white to beige head. Smell and taste malts, lightly roasty, dont get the sourness though. Medium body and carbonation.
Rötlich-dunkelbraun mit normaler Schaumbildung. Getreidig-brotiges Aroma mit Karamell. Im Geschmack dito. Der recht hohe Alk. ist gut eingebunden.

50cl bottle courtesy of thistrybird @ RBBSG II. 
Ambrée, col fin beige.
Arôme est malté très allemand dans lapproche avec un citronné modéré, je note très peu le bouquet aigre.
Palais est malté moyen, caramel sur une influence bien allemande avec un caramel prenant sans être trop doux suivi dune petite note chocolatée. Le côté sour si il y en a un manque à lappel.
Reste sympa de cette brasserie qui tente de revisiter les styles allemands.

Bottle. Deep brown color with a long lasting off-white head. Aroma of peat, smoke and toasted malt. Slightly sour, earthy taste. Nice medium bitter finish. Oily feel. The alcohol gives warmth but it hides well on the background.

# 100 German beer. Courtesy of ThirstyBird. Thx! 50 cl. bottle sampled @ RBBSG II. Reddish amber, no head. Smell carries light chlorine, light malts, iron, touch caramel syrup, pretty weak, Taste is slightly sweet berries, malts, bitter herbs, weak, ehh, spices, touch cocoa and roast, light iron, Body is a bit light, iron like, Where is the sourness? Ehh far from exiting.
Light roasted malt nose. Caramel cereals, sour hops, bitter finish. Surprisingly smooth brew with sweetness covering well the alcohol.
Bottled. Dark amber coloured. Dense light beige head. Aroma: Sourness, herbs, fruits. Flavour: Sourness, grape, fruits, light caramel medium bodied. Ends sourish and grapy with a caramelly touch.

Bottle at yespr.
Hazy orange coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and malty aroma of caramel and bread.
Sweet and malty flavour of caramel and bread.
Sweet finish.
On tap at Gourmet Haus. Pours a chestnut brown with a white head. Taste of caramel malt with a slight sour background. Creamy and smooth.
Bottled. A hazy deep red beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt caramel and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and straw, leading to a dry fin.

clear brown, small white head.
aroma is roasted malty, slightly sort of flowery.
flavor is malty, caramelly, slightly sweet.
50 cL bottle. Pours hazy brown with a small off white head. Aroma is roasted malty and breadish. Bitter and roasted malty. Smoked and lingering malty and light smoked. Roasted and bitter finish.
Bottle from Bierland, deep brown, coffee and wine on the nose, sour fruit, strawberries and more coffee on the palate, dry and spicy, hint of dark cocoa and soy sauce and oak.

murky chestnut, thin cream head. Lactic cherry nose, sugary and heavy soy. Sticky thick mouth, heavy residual sugar and cherry syrup, light plum with oaky finish. All over the place, very little to enjoy.
Bottle @ de Bierkoning. Brown color, Vinous aroma. Thinnish, slightly alcoholic vinous flavor with grapes, raspberry, citrus. Caramel. Matured and powerful. Nice one.

Big thanks to Erzengel for that bottle. Looks really good. Beer in the glass deep black, small head. Starts strong-malty, but not too alkocolic. Some earthy notes together with some chocolate. More and more sourish and fruity like berries. Finish a bit drier, fruity aftertaste. Well balanced and the alcohol is really well hidden. Nice surprise!

Tap. Pours clear brown with creamy off-white head. Aroma is sour fruit, balsamic vinegar, caramel and cookie malts, and some floral notes. Flavor is balanced bready malts, tart fruit, and floral hop bitterness with faint woody notes; dry finish. Medium body and low carbonation.

Tap at Maxs. Pours dark brown with a medium, frothy light tan head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is sour stone fruit, cookie and toast malt. Flavor is sour malt and stone fruit with light hops and bitterness and a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Amazing concept. It smells sour but the sourness is more lemony that tart. It also remains that darker irony taste that alts have. The beer even has some straw and raspberry hints. Pretty amazing. On tap at In de Wildeman.
Sample at The Festival. Hazy reddish brown color, tan head. Aroma of toasty caramel and dark fruit. Taste is sour prunes, caramel, light brandy. Delicious.

(bottle) Hazy, dark brown colour with a ruby shine and a mid-sized tanned foamy head. Slightly yeasty, dark and mildly roasted malty aroma with notes of anise, cacao, liquorice and leather, accompanied by subtle fruity hints and a whiff of smoke. Sweet and delicately bitter flavour, medium to full bodied with a calm carbonation. Slightly earthy dark malt-character with liquorice, dark chocolate and a vaguely fruity touch; mildly sweet and roasty bitter finish with a tinge of acidity at the very end, as well as a perfectly muted alcoholic strength. A very complex brew, also quite balanced. 06.VI.13
Süßlich, malziger Geruch. Startet in Richtung Malz, leicht säuerlich, rauchig, schokoladig. Schluß schokoladig, malzbitter, leichte Fruchtnote. Gefällt.

Minimal säuerlicher Antrunk, der entfernt am einen Weizenbock erinnert. Kirschen, dunkles Malz, etwas Karamell. Würzig, nie sind die 10% erkennbar. Zum Ende wenig süß, aromatisch malzig, gut. 11/11/11/12//12

A bottle directly from the brewery. 
dark-brown in the glass, the head is nearly ivory-white. Nose is fruity, caramel, molasses. 
The beer starts sweet-aromatic. molasses, dark cherries, caramel. The sourness starts after a few seconds, but fits ideal into the rest of the beer. 
Very drinkable for 10%. Nearly no alcohol tastable. 
In the end, hops come through and make this beer a nice bitter-sour ending with still the caramel and the dark cherries finding their spot. 
--> Great beer!
